results.title: Alice in Wonderland
results.brief_description: On a golden afternoon, young Alice follows a White Rabbit, who disappears down a nearby rabbit hole. Quickly following him, she tumbles into the burrow - and enters the merry, topsy-turvy world of Wonderland! Memorable songs and whimsical escapades highlight Alice’s journey, which culminates in a madcap encounter with the Queen of Hearts - and her army of playing cards!

constellations_other.name: MoCaps and rotos
constellations_other.description: Though VFX continues to push boundaries and brings fantastical worlds and creatures to life, there's still a place for classic animation techniques.

results.title: Alice in Wonderland
results.creator_credit: Wilfred Jackson, Hamilton Luske, Clyde Geronimi, Walt Disney, Ben Sharpsteen and Walt Disney Animation Studios
results.brief_description: Animated version of Lewis Carroll’s famous story about the delightful Alice who goes on a dream fantasy adventure where animals are like humans and everything is nonsense. Voices provided by Kathryn Beaumont, Ed Wynn, Richard Haydn and Stirling Holloway.

results.title: Alice in wonderland
results.creator_credit: Nick Willing, Dyson Lovell, Babelsberg International Film Produktion and Hallmark Entertainment
results.brief_description: After running away from home, Alice steps into a rabbit hole and enters an incredible magical world full of adventure. Originally produced for television, this adaptation of the Lewis Carroll classic features an impressive cast and special effects from Frame Store and Jim Henson’s Creature Shop. Cast includes Robbie Coltrane, Whoopi Goldberg, Ben Kingsley, Christopher Lloyd, Martin Short and many more.

results.title: Alice in the cities = Alice in den Stadten
results.creator_credit: Wim Wenders, Joachim von Mengershausen and Filmverlag der Autoren
results.brief_description: Through the story of a disillusioned young photojournalist who, returning from a fruitless assignment in the States, unwittingly becomes involved in a little girl’s search for her family in the North German industrial heartland, Wenders forges a distinctly European variation on the road movie. Few films capture so evocatively the feeling of life in the 20th century technological jungle, but for all its vistas of alienation and Americanisation, “Alice in the cities” finally resolves itself into a touching, indeed moving, affirmation of human relationships in an otherwise bleak world. Cast includes Rudiger Vogler and Yella Rottlander, with a haunting musical score by Can.

results.title: Alice in blunderland
results.creator_credit: W M. Moloney and Road Safety Council of New South Wales
results.brief_description: Road safety film made in Sydney using a parallel with the Alice in Wonderland fairytale to discuss issues of pedestrian and driver safety. Focusses on Alice who is more intent on her shopping than on paying attention to the traffic. She meets up with her boyfriend, “The Mad Hatter” and they go for a drive in the country and demonstrate the dangers of admiring the scenery instead of the road. Gives statistics comparing road deaths in NSW with WWII casualties. Features flashback footage of Sydney in 1908.

results.title: Alice Guy-Blaché
results.brief_description: Alice Guy-Blaché was a trailblazing French director, producer and screenwriter, and the co-founder and artistic director of her own film studio. She made hundreds of films between during her career, including the first fictional film with a scripted narrative, La Fée aux Choux

constellations_primary.name: Lost and found
constellations_primary.description: Blossoming from Alice Guy Blaché’s The Cabbage-Patch Fairy, this Constellation explores the impermanence and enduring nature of the moving image.

results.description:
Alice Guy-Blaché was a trailblazing French director, producer and screenwriter, and the co-founder and artistic director of her own film studio, Solax. She made hundreds of films between 1896 and the 1920s, including the first fictional film with a scripted narrative, La Fée aux Choux (The Cabbage Fairy, 1896).

Guy-Blaché later experimented with early synchronised sound, colour and special effects, often filming on location with hundreds of extras. In 1912 she made A Fool and His Money, widely believed to be the first film to have an all–African American cast.

To find our more about Alice Guy-Blaché, rent Be Natural: The Untold Story of Alice Guy-Blaché on our streaming platform, Cinema 3.
description_for_label:
Alice Guy-Blaché was a trailblazing French director, producer and screenwriter, and the co-founder and artistic director of her own film studio, Solax. She made hundreds of films between 1896 and the 1920s, including the first fictional film with a scripted narrative, La Fée aux Choux (The Cabbage Fairy, 1896).

Guy-Blaché later experimented with early synchronised sound, colour and special effects, often filming on location with hundreds of extras. In 1912 she made A Fool and His Money, widely believed to be the first film to have an all–African American cast.

results.title: Alice Elliot
results.brief_description: The Promo Indians are among the world’s finest basket-makers. Alice Elliot is one of a few Promo continuing this centuries-old tradition.

results.title: Alice doesn't live here anymore
results.creator_credit: Martin Scorsese, Audrey Maas, David Susskind and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: In her remarkable Academy Award winning portrayal, Ellen Burstyn stars as Alice, a recently widowed housewife who packs herself and her son into a station wagon and heads off in search of a better life. Alice travels a bumpy road - no money, nowhere jobs and not much luck. She fights back with a spirited determination, which underscores this moving, often funny tale of one woman’s struggle for self-awareness and independence. With ‘Alice Doesn’t Live Here Anymore’, director Martin Scorsese shows that he is equally at home in semi-rural surroundings as he is in the asphalt jungle of ‘Taxi Driver’. The outstanding supporting cast includes Kris Kristofferson, Jodie Foster and Harvey Keitel.

results.title: Alice and Martin = Alice et Martin
results.creator_credit: Andre Techine, Alain Sarde, October Films, Les Films Alain Sarde, Studio Canal+, France 3 Cinema and France 2 Cinema
results.brief_description: After his father’s death, twenty year old Martin (Alexis Loret) goes missing. He eventually reappears at his brother’s Paris apartment and moves in with him and his housemate Alice (Juliette Binoche). Martin finds success as a fashion model and begins a tentative sexual relationship with the shy Alice. But when Martin hears that she has fallen pregnant this results in a breakdown where the shattering truth of what occurred during his disappearance threatens to destroy him and his relationship. As Techine showed in his earlier work, “Wild Reeds”, he is a master of acute observations of human need and desire. The fractured individuals at the heart of “Alice and Martin” are all seeking solace and safety. Neither detachedly bleak nor fashionably cynical, Techine’s work recalls the strong humanist tradition in French cinema: he is certainly Jean Renoir’s heir. But this is no revisionist or conservative cinema. Techine’s fine intimate portraits are alive to both the possibilities of cinema and the complex sexual and gender relationships at the core of modern life. With Carmen Maura. In French with English subtitles.
